intro: Lipochaeta profusa var. robustior, commonly known as the robust lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in dense, compact clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
